name: Herbertson, Appellant, v. American Fruit Growers, Inc.
name_abbreviation: Herbertson v. American Fruit Growers, Inc.

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Herbertson, Appellant, v. American Fruit Growers, Inc.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
An examination of the record in this case fails to disclose such a clear case as to warrant entry of judgment for want of a sufficient affidavit of defense. The order discharging the rule is affirmed at appellant’s costs.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Harvey Morton Aronson, with him Walter M. Newman, for appellant.
Harry S. Dunmire, with him R. T. M. McCready, for appellee, were not heard.
casebody.head_matter:
Herbertson, Appellant, v. American Fruit Growers, Inc.
Argued April 2, 1935.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
Harvey Morton Aronson, with him Walter M. Newman, for appellant.
Harry S. Dunmire, with him R. T. M. McCready, for appellee, were not heard.
April 22, 1935:
